etymologies: late Middle English (as a verb): from French transférer or Latin transferre, from trans- ‘across’ + ferre ‘to bear’. The earliest use of the noun (late 17th century) was as a legal term in the sense ‘conveyance of property’

definitions: move from one place to another

examples.text: I went to sleep on the couch before transferring to my bedroom later in the night
he would have to transfer money to his own account

shortDefinitions: move from one place to another

definitions: move to another group, occupation, or service

examples.text: she transferred to the Physics Department
employees have been transferred to the installation team

shortDefinitions: move to another department, occupation, etc.

definitions: enroll in a different school or college

examples.text: Ron transferred to the University of Idaho

shortDefinitions: enroll in different school or college

definitions: (in professional sports) move or cause to move to another team

examples.text: he transferred to the Dodgers
when a player is transferred to the minors by a major league club

shortDefinitions: (in football and other sports) move to another team

definitions: redirect (a telephone call) to another line or extension.
shortDefinitions: redirect telephone call to new line or extension

definitions: copy (a drawing or design) from one surface to another

examples.text: drawings can be transferred to the artwork by rubbing them off the sheet

shortDefinitions: copy drawing or design from one surface to another

definitions: copy (data, music, etc.) from one medium or device to another

examples.text: you can easily transfer your personal data to another PC using the export feature

shortDefinitions: copy (data, music, etc.) from one medium or device

definitions: change to another place, route, or means of transportation during a journey

examples.text: John advised him to transfer from Rome airport to the railroad station

shortDefinitions: change to another place, route, or means of transport during journey

definitions: make over the possession of (property, a right, or a responsibility) to someone else

examples.text: we will transfer full planning responsibility to local authorities

shortDefinitions: make over possession of property, right, or responsibility to another

definitions: change (the sense of a word or phrase) by extension or metaphor

examples.text: between Latin and English, the sense was transferred from the inhabitants to the place
a transferred use of the Old English noun

shortDefinitions: change sense of word or phrase by extension or metaphor

definitions: an act of moving something or someone to another place

examples.text: a transfer of wealth to the poorer nations
she was going to ask her boss for a transfer to the city
a patient had died after transfer from the County Hospital to St. Peter's

shortDefinitions: act of moving something or someone to another place, organization, team

definitions: an act of selling or moving an athlete to another team

examples.text: his transfer from Rangers cost £800,000

shortDefinitions: act of selling or moving athlete to another team

definitions: a student who has enrolled in a different school or college.
shortDefinitions: student who has enrolled in different school or college

definitions: a conveyance of property, especially stocks, from one person to another

examples.text: the transfer of assets from wealthy individuals to family members

shortDefinitions: conveyance of property from one person to another

definitions: the action of copying data from one medium or device to another.
shortDefinitions: action of copying data from one medium or device

definitions: a small colored picture or design on paper, which can be transferred to another surface by being pressed or heated

examples.text: T-shirts with iron-on transfers

shortDefinitions: small coloured picture or design on paper, which can be transferred to another surface by being pressed or heated

definitions: an act of changing to another place, route, or means of transportation during a journey

examples.text: it took three hours and several bus transfers to get there

shortDefinitions: act of changing to another place, route, or means of transport during journey

definitions: a ticket allowing a passenger to change from one public transportation vehicle to another as part of a single journey

examples.text: you get a transfer, you have to get that train

shortDefinitions: ticket allowing passenger to change from one public transport vehicle to another as part of single journey
